CPL 2023

uvhpcl53y.content: Reach out:

LH8-vUcN0D.content:
2020 - June

Greenland

Many think of Greenland as this vast land of ice, but its so much more than that. The pristine and unique nature is a heavy influence on the local culture and cuisine and no wonder: anyone, who has sailed on the Greenland Sea during the summer understands why. While the winters are long and dark, the summer is equally a celebration of light. The Arctic can be unforgiving, but its unique ecosystem with the eagles, seals, and whales makes it all worthwhile.

_o0VGFThKM.content:
2022

CSG OPEN

Hard to beat the hand eye coordination required in globally popular sport - ping pong, less than 10 feet distance between the opponents and smashes thundering at 140 kilometres an hour, only the reflexes can control that sort of a speed

cDVkNpJMvd.content:
2019 - September

Kamchatka

Kamchatka is often an overlooked part of the world, but this Russian peninsula offers a wild setting for some truly out of this world photography. Since its largely unexplored and fairly remote, photographers can expect wild beauty in the form of geologically active landscapes. With over 160 volcanoes, theres something for everyone.

sFUE0BIHfJ.content:
2020 - May

Tuscany

The rolling hills of central Italy make one of the most photographed backdrops to many photographers favorite sceneries. Tuscany offers something across the year: the sunflower fields of summer change to poppies as the seasons change. The postcard-esque landscape rewards the early risers with misty sunrises. The golden hour truly shows its real meaning in Tuscany.
